alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:44AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIDESPREAD LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN TODAY... Broad southerly winds at and above the surface will continue the warming trend across Southwest Alaska today. Most locations across the region this morning are hovering between 30 and 35 degrees, and temperatures will continue to increase through the day today as winds increase. Precipitation is expected to fall as rain, which will spread from west to east. Rain falling onto snow covered surfaces, particularly roadways or trails that are compacted, are likely to become icy. Exercise caution while traveling. Due to above freezing temperatures at the surface, rain is not expected to accumulate and build on surfaces. Cold air will move back in starting late Wednesday night/early Thursday morning over the Kuskokwim Delta, spreading east to Bristol Bay and the interior Kuskokwim later in the day. A brief shot of snow may accompany the cold air returning, but accumulations will be minimal.

area.areaDesc: Bristol Bay; Kuskokwim Delta; Lower Kuskokwim Valley
